metadata.title: CVE-2017-6961 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in apng2gif 1.7. There is improper sanitization ofuser input causing huge memory allocations, resulting in a crash. This isrelated to the read_chunk function using the pChunk->size value (within thePNG file) to determine the amount of memory to allocate.

criterions.comment: apng2gif: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
